channel.title: Which Language
channel.description:
Well, I want to learn a coding language. I'm a newbie at coding, besides css and html. Php I'm alright but I would like trying to learn something new, that does not include the web. Could someone please point me in any directions? I would start off learning php, but, the manual is way to boring, and goes way to fast. What I was thinking of learning -Mastered CSS (very easy) -Php + MySql (haven't learned mysql yet) -Python -Java -Visual Basics -C++ -.NET FRAMEWORK
if someone could suggest a good newbies beganing language, that would be great. [i]Thank you.[/i]

item.title: Which Language
item.dc:creator: @supamagier supamagier
item.description:
@supamagier wrote:

C++ or Java.

Al those shit about ‘easy to get started, etc’, that are stupid reasons. Just start learning a language that’s used a lot, you’ll pick up everything while learning. (Get yourself an editor), and dl other ppls src codes. That’s the best way to learn.

Read full topic

item.title: Which Language
item.dc:creator: @wow_raped_XD wow_raped XD
item.description:
@wow_raped_XD wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:29, topic:218270”]On topic, If you decide to pick a language from the .Net library (C++,C#,J#,VB.net) Pick C#, get average with it, then learn the little difference in syntax between Java and C# and the different libraries then once you have done that, You’ve got C#,J#,Java under your belt. C# - microsoft’s own language using the .Net framework. J# - microsoft’s java syntax version, using the .net framework (not sure why this was needed, C# is too close as it is) and Java with its Multi platform capabilities and own class libraries to take advantage of.

If your a windows user, id highly recommend what i just said. If not, stick with Java only.[/quote]
Well, I will probaly end up learning the .net stuff…so thanks anyways.

Read full topic

item.title: Which Language
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

On topic, If you decide to pick a language from the .Net library (C++,C#,J#,VB.net) Pick C#, get average with it, then learn the little difference in syntax between Java and C# and the different libraries then once you have done that, You’ve got C#,J#,Java under your belt. C# - microsoft’s own language using the .Net framework. J# - microsoft’s java syntax version, using the .net framework (not sure why this was needed, C# is too close as it is) and Java with its Multi platform capabilities and own class libraries to take advantage of.

If your a windows user, id highly recommend what i just said. If not, stick with Java only.

Read full topic

SQL and regexes are fairly simple to learn, and they’re usable in virtually every language.

most are copy and paste, and I don’t learn anything.[quote=“Unhandled, post:23, topic:218270”][quote author=wow_raped XD link=topic=286821.msg2322801#msg2322801 date=1215570329]

http://www.w3schools.com/php/default.asp

I’ve known of w3 for a long time, but I never knew the explained php that well, and once I’m done with w3, where do i go then?
[/quote]
http://tizag.com/[/quote]
